title: Mauricio González (footballer)
text:
Mauricio Ernesto González Barillas (May 13, 1942 – 15 December 2018) was an <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player from <a href="El%20Salvador">El Salvador</a> who played as a <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a>.
Club career.
González played the majority of his career for <a href="C.D.%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Marte">Atlético Marte</a>, with whom he won one league title. He also had a spell abroad with <a href="Guatemala">Guatemala</a>n side <a href="Club%20Xelaj%C3%BA%20MC">Xelajú MC</a>.
International career.
Nicknamed "Pachín", he represented his country at the <a href="1968%20Summer%20Olympics">1968 Summer Olympics</a>. González also participated at the <a href="1963%20CONCACAF%20Championship">1963 CONCACAF Championship</a> and the <a href="1965%20CONCACAF%20Championship">1965 CONCACAF Championship</a> where he scored a total of 5 goals in 10 matches.
Personal life.
Mauricio was the eldest brother of Salvadoran football legend <a href="M%C3%A1gico%20Gonz%C3%A1lez">Jorge Mágico González</a> and son of <a href="%C3%93scar%20Ernesto%20Gonz%C3%A1lez">Óscar Ernesto González</a> and <a href="Victoria%20Barillas">Victoria Barillas</a>. He was married to Fermina and they had 5 children.
Death.
Gonzales died from natural causes on the 15th of December 2018.
